alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 5:57AM CDT until July 09 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN CANADIAN, NORTHWESTERN CLEVELAND AND WESTERN OKLAHOMA COUNTIES... At 557 AM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Areas around Bethany, Moore, and Oklahoma City. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. Reports of numerous water rescues as well as moving water over roadways and bridges in Moore and Oklahoma City. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oklahoma City, northern Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Warr Acres, The Village, Piedmont, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Nicoma Park, Valley Brook, Tinker Air Force Base, Stanley Draper Lake and Forest Park. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
